EventPoller * Mercury::EventPoller::create (  )  [static]

This static method creates an appropriate EventPoller.

It may use select or epoll.

bool Mercury::EventPoller::deregisterForRead ( int  fd  ) 

This method deregisters a file previously registered for reading.

This method deregisters a file previously registered for writing.

Implemented in Mercury::SelectPoller, and Mercury::EPoller.

Implemented in Mercury::SelectPoller, and Mercury::EPoller.

virtual bool Mercury::EventPoller::doRegisterForWrite ( int  fd  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Implemented in Mercury::SelectPoller, and Mercury::EPoller.

int Mercury::EventPoller::getFileDescriptor (  )  const [virtual]

This method returns the file descriptor for this EventPoller or -1 if it does not have one.

For epoll, this is used to register with the parent EventDispatcher's poller.

Reimplemented in Mercury::EPoller.

int Mercury::EventPoller::handleInputNotification ( int  fd  )  [virtual]

This method overrides the InputNotificationHandler.

It is called when there are events to process.

Implements Mercury::InputNotificationHandler.

bool Mercury::EventPoller::isRegistered ( int  fd,
bool  isForRead 
) const [protected]

This method returns whether or not a file descriptor is already registered.

Parameters:
fd The file descriptor to test.
isForRead Indicates whether checking for read or write registration.
Returns:
True if registered, otherwise false.

int Mercury::EventPoller::maxFD (  )  const [protected]

Returns the largest file descriptor present in both the read or write handler maps.

If neither have entries, -1 is returned.

virtual int Mercury::EventPoller::processPendingEvents ( double  maxWait  )  [pure virtual]

This method polls the registered file descriptors for events.

Parameters:
maxWait The maximum number of seconds to wait for events.

Implemented in Mercury::SelectPoller, and Mercury::EPoller.

InputNotificationHandler *  handler
